title: Software Developer 1
description:
**Job Description**
 As a member of the software engineering division, you will use basic knowledge of software architecture to perform tasks associated with developing, debugging or designing software applications or operating systems according to the provided design specifications. Build enhancements within an existing software architecture.
   

  

 Job Description:
   

  

* Make enhancements to existing software applications.
* Develop and design new reports, including data fetching through SQL, data processing, and data representation based on requirements.
* Gather requirements, understand project scope, create work estimates, and effectively plan and execute tasks.
* Handle client calls and collaborate with stakeholders to ensure requirements are met.
* Participate in component\\-level technical design discussions and collaborations.
* Perform debugging and document root cause analysis and resolutions.
* Identify and suggest process improvements at the team level to support both operations and the development ecosystem.
* Provide support for software releases.
* Gain an understanding of healthcare workflows and the Millennium data model.


 Qualifications:
   

  

 Bachelor's Degree or above in one of the following
   

  

* Computer Science
* Computer Engineering
* Software Engineering
* Computer Applications
* Computer Information Systems
* Information Technology
* Information Systems


 Skills:
   

  

 Required: SQL, PL\\-SQL, Database Management Systems, Programming (e.g., Python, Java, C\\+\\+), Debugging, Version Control (Git), Unit Testing, Data Analysis,
   

  

 Soft Skills: Problem\\-Solving, Collaboration, Communication, Attention to Detail, Adaptability, Time Management, Continuous Learning, Mentorship (even if basic, ability to help peers)
   

  

 Good to have: Business Intelligence Tools (Tableau, Business Object, Power Insight, DA2\\), CCL, Healthcare Workflow
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As a member of the software engineering division, you will apply basic to intermediate knowledge of software architecture to perform software development tasks associated with developing, debugging or designing software applications or operating systems according to provided design specifications.
